intro: Genista pedunculata var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth broom, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, often branching stems that are typically hairless or nearly so, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces small, yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are alternate and compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides.
